pe":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"recipient","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transferFrom","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"applyTransactionFee(uint256)":{"params":{"amountBeforeFee":"The amount the user will receive before transaction fee is applied."},"return":"amountAfterFee The amount the user will receive with transaction fee applied."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"buyDai(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","minDaiToReceive":"The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive."}},"buyEcl(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before, otherwise reverts.","minEclToReceive":"The minimum amount of ECL the user is willing to receive."}},"calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"A value of one is subtracted in the _bToReceive calculation such that roundingerrors favour the pool over the user.","params":{"aBalance":"The balance of asset A in the liquidity pool.","aSent":"The quantity of asset A sent by the user to the liquidity pool.","bBalance":"The balance of asset B in the liquidity pool."},"return":"bToReceive The quantity of asset B the user would receive before transaction fee is applied."},"calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"ethBalanceOfDaiPoolLocal":"The balance of ETH in the DAI liquidity pool.","ethBalanceOfEclPoolLocal":"The balance of ETH in the ECL liquidity pool.","ethSent":"The quantity of ETH sent by the user in the buyEcl function."},"return":"ethTransferToDaiPool The quantity of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"daiSold":"The amount of DAI the user is selling.","deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","eclSold":"The amount of ECL the user is selling.","minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","eclSold":"The amount of ECL the user is selling.","minDaiToReceive":"The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.","minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."}},"title":"The Eclipseum ERC20 Smart Contract"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"applyTransactionFee(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the amount for the user to receive with a 0.3% transaction fee applied."},"buyDai(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Enables a user to buy DAI with ETH from the DAI liquidity pool."},"buyEcl(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Enables a user to buy ECL with ETH from the ECL liquidity pool."},"calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates amount of asset B for user to receive using constant product market maker algorithm."},"calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the amount of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool for the buyEcl function."},"circulatingSupply()":{"notice":"Returns the circulating supply of ECL."},"constructor":"Must be called with at least 0.02 ETH.Mints 100,000 ECL into the contract account","daiBalanceOfDaiPool()":{"notice":"Returns the DAI balance of the DAI pool."},"eclBalanceOfEclPool()":{"notice":"Returns the ECL balance of the ECL pool."},"ethBalanceOfDaiPool()":{"notice":"Returns the ETH balance of the DAI pool."},"launch()":{"notice":"This function is called once after deployment to launch the contract.Some amount of DAI must be transferred to the contract for launch to succeed.Once launched, the transaction functions may be invoked."},"sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Enables a user to sell DAI for ETH to the DAI liquidity pool."},"sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Enables a user to sell ECL for ETH to the ECL liquidity pool."},"softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Enables a user to sell ECL for ETH and DAI to the ECL liquidity pool."}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/contracts/Eclipseum.sol":"Eclipseum"},"evmVersion":"constantinople","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/contracts/Eclipseum.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf8271c096401761def331a1aa9994808e854ae7ef1e48df1f819a2275fec0b33","urls":["bzz-raw://3c2bf9c1600056ba63d1b970dd71b941f4b669b96069760193c61275848cadd3","dweb:/ipfs/QmTgMgqvSCorXRdUbXSWgeCTic3T4EkpHojra4FgvroYN3"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/GSN/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x90a3995645af7562d84b9d69363ffa5ae7217714ab61e951bf7bc450f40e4061","urls":["bzz-raw://216ef9d6b614db4eb46970b4e84903f2534a45572dd30a79f0041f1a5830f436","dweb:/ipfs/QmNPrJ4MWKUAWzKXpUqeyKRUfosaoANZAqXgvepdrCwZAG"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x640b6dee7a4b830bdfd52b5031a07fc2b12209f5b2e29e5d364a7d37f69d8076","urls":["bzz-raw://31113152e1ddb78fe7a4197f247591ca894e93f916867beb708d8e747b6cc74f","dweb:/ipfs/QmbZaJyXdpsYGykVhHH9qpVGQg9DGCxE2QufbCUy3daTgq"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb15af804e2bc97db51e4e103f13de9fe13f87e6b835d7a88c897966c0e58506e","urls":["bzz-raw://1e8cff8437557fc915a3bed968fcd8f2df9809599e665ef69c2c9ce628548055","dweb:/ipfs/QmP5spYP8vs2jvLF8zNrXUbqB79hMsoEvMHiLcBxerWKcm"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20Detailed.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4a3a810b7ebe742e897e1fd428b3eeed2196d3acea58eaf9c566ed10d545d2ed","urls":["bzz-raw://28d03f328e19e4099d5013de0649afaeaabac1a614e130767ab1cb4aca9775b6","dweb:/ipfs/Qmb9iW7yNuYehB2NfhRMs9TakqbLVQhBhmGMkaDZ5g1Eb4"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-core/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe5bb0f57cff3e299f360052ba50f1ea0fff046df2be070b6943e0e3c3fdad8 params.amountBeforeFee: The amount the user will receive before transaction fee is applied.

applyTransactionFee(uint256).return: amountAfterFee The amount the user will receive with transaction fee applied.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params.deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params.minDaiToReceive: The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.

params.deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before, otherwise reverts.
params.minEclToReceive: The minimum amount of ECL the user is willing to receive.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: A value of one is subtracted in the _bToReceive calculation such that roundingerrors favour the pool over the user.

params.aBalance: The balance of asset A in the liquidity pool.
params.aSent: The quantity of asset A sent by the user to the liquidity pool.
params.bBalance: The balance of asset B in the liquidity pool.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).return: bToReceive The quantity of asset B the user would receive before transaction fee is applied.

params.ethBalanceOfDaiPoolLocal: The balance of ETH in the DAI liquidity pool.
params.ethBalanceOfEclPoolLocal: The balance of ETH in the ECL liquidity pool.
params.ethSent: The quantity of ETH sent by the user in the buyEcl function.

calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256.return: ethTransferToDaiPool The quantity of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params.daiSold: The amount of DAI the user is selling.
params.deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params.minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

params.deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params.eclSold: The amount of ECL the user is selling.
params.minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

params.deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params.eclSold: The amount of ECL the user is selling.
params.minDaiToReceive: The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.
params.minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

applyTransactionFee(uint256).notice: Calculates the amount for the user to receive with a 0.3% transaction fee applied.

buyDai(uint256,uint256).notice: Enables a user to buy DAI with ETH from the DAI liquidity pool.

buyEcl(uint256,uint256).notice: Enables a user to buy ECL with ETH from the ECL liquidity pool.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates amount of asset B for user to receive using constant product market maker algorithm.

calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256.notice: Calculates the amount of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool for the buyEcl function.

circulatingSupply().notice: Returns the circulating supply of ECL.

methods.constructor: Must be called with at least 0.02 ETH.Mints 100,000 ECL into the contract account

daiBalanceOfDaiPool().notice: Returns the DAI balance of the DAI pool.

eclBalanceOfEclPool().notice: Returns the ECL balance of the ECL pool.

ethBalanceOfDaiPool().notice: Returns the ETH balance of the DAI pool.

launch().notice: This function is called once after deployment to launch the contract.Some amount of DAI must be transferred to the contract for launch to succeed.Once launched, the transaction functions may be invoked.

sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Enables a user to sell DAI for ETH to the DAI liquidity pool.

sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Enables a user to sell ECL for ETH to the ECL liquidity pool.

softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Enables a user to sell ECL for ETH and DAI to the ECL liquidity pool.
